TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit IncrementalStrokeHitTester extends System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalHitTester

Docs.summary: Dynamically hit tests a stroke with an eraser path.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> hit tests strokes by determining when a eraser path intersects that stroke. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalHitTester.AddPoints%2A> method in the stylus events to add the points to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester>. When the points added to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> intersect a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester> raises the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.IncrementalStrokeHitTester.StrokeHit> event.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to dynamically erase a portion of a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke>. To create a control that enables a user to erase ink, see [How to: Erase Ink on a Custom Control](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/how-to-erase-ink-on-a-custom-control.md).
[!code-csharp[InkEraser#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/CSharp/InkEraser.cs#2)] [!code-vb[InkEraser#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/InkEraser/VisualBasic/InkEraser.vb#2)]
